data.label: ChatOpenAI
data.name: chatOpenAI
data.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Automatically uses gpt-4-vision-preview when image is being uploaded from chat. Only works with LLMChain, Conversation Chain, ReAct Agent, and Conversational Agent

inputParams.label: Image Resolution
inputParams.description: This parameter controls the resolution in which the model views the image.
inputParams.name: imageResolution

outputAnchors.name: chatOpenAI
outputAnchors.label: ChatOpenAI
outputAnchors.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

data.label: LLM Chain
data.name: llmChain
data.description: Chain to run queries against LLMs

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

data.label: Chat Prompt Template
data.name: chatPromptTemplate
data.description: Schema to represent a chat prompt

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.placeholder: You are a helpful assistant that translates {input_language} to {output_language}.

inputs.systemMessagePrompt:
As an AI assistant specializing in meeting analysis and note-taking, your task is to create a comprehensive and detailed overview of a meeting based on a full transcript. Please structure your notes as follows:
1. Header
Meeting Title
Date and Time
Attendees (list all participants)
Link to Recording: [Insert link here]

2. Table of Contents
Create a detailed table of contents with timestamps for each major section and subsection. Format as follows:
[Timestamp] Section Title
[Timestamp] Subsection Title

3. Executive Summary (250-300 words)
Provide a concise overview of the meeting in one or two paragraphs. Be sure to include:
Main purpose of the meeting
Key participants and their roles
High-level summary of main topics discussed
Critical decisions made
Overall meeting outcome

4. Detailed Meeting Notes
For each main topic or agenda item:

4.1 [Topic Title]
Context: Briefly explain why this topic was discussed
Bullet point list of key points:
List main ideas, arguments, Decisions, action items, challenges, concerns or information shared
If you need to quote someone, use the format: "[Name]: [Key point]"

5. Overall Action Items and Next Steps
Compile a comprehensive list of all action items and next steps from the entire meeting:
Action Item: [Description]
Assigned to: [Name]
Deadline: [Date] (if discussed)
Related Topic: [Topic Title]

6. Open Questions and Parking Lot Items
List any unresolved questions or items that were deferred for future discussion.


Guidelines:
Use clear, concise language
Maintain objectivity in reporting discussions and decisions
Use bullet points for better readability
Include direct quotes when they significantly contribute to understanding
Highlight important information, decisions, or action items
Ensure all acronyms are spelled out on first use
Double-check that all names and technical terms are spelled correctly

Use this Transcript:
{transcript}
inputs.humanMessagePrompt: Please analyze the provided transcript thoroughly and create the meeting notes following this structure. Ensure that the notes are comprehensive, well-organized, and capture all essential information from the meeting.

outputAnchors.name: chatPromptTemplate
outputAnchors.label: ChatPromptTemplate
outputAnchors.description: Schema to represent a chat prompt

inputParams.label: Text
inputParams.name: text
inputParams.placeholder: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua...

inputParams.label: Additional Metadata
inputParams.name: metadata
inputParams.description: Additional metadata to be added to the extracted documents

inputParams.label: Omit Metadata Keys
inputParams.name: omitMetadataKeys
inputParams.description: Each document loader comes with a default set of metadata keys that are extracted from the document. You can use this field to omit some of the default metadata keys. The value should be a list of keys, seperated by comma. Use * to omit all metadata keys execept the ones you specify in the Additional Metadata field
